name: SCOPUS Journal Article Template
description: A clean, structured template for writing SCOPUS-style academic articles. Includes sections for title, authors, abstract, keywords, and standard article sections to help you get started quickly.
content:
Title of the Article

Authors: Your Name, Co-author Name

Affiliation: Department, University, City, Country

Email: your.email@example.com

Abstract

[Provide a concise summary of your research, including objectives, methods, key results, and conclusions.]

Keywords

keyword1; keyword2; keyword3

1. Introduction

[Introduce the topic, provide background, state the objectives, and justify the study.]

2. Materials and Methods

[Describe the materials, data collection, and analytical methods in detail.]

3. Results

[Present your results clearly and concisely, including tables, figures, and key findings.]

4. Discussion

[Interpret the results, compare with previous studies, discuss implications and limitations.]

5. Conclusions

[Summarize the key findings and suggest future research directions.]

References

  1. Author(s). (Year). Title of the article. Journal Name, Volume(Issue), pages. DOI/Publisher Link.
  2. Author(s). (Year). Title of the article. Journal Name, Volume(Issue), pages. DOI/Publisher Link.

name: The Outline method
description: The outline method of taking notes is one of the most intuitive and simplest options on this list. As the name suggests, this method turns notes into a hierarchy of information, providing a logical flow of content on the page and keeping it highly organized.
content:

name: The Cornell method
description: The Cornell method of note-taking was designed for students by Cornell University professor Walter Pauk. Similar to the outline method, Cornell encourages note-takers to keep clean, organized, and condensed notes. It’s an especially useful method for revisiting your notes, reviewing what you learned, and consolidating your new knowledge.

  • Question 3

Note-taking area

Summary

name: The Boxing method
description: The boxing method of note-taking is geared toward those who are visual-dominant learners. This form of note-taking consists of creating boxes or outlines to represent different sections or ideas within your notes.
content:
Topic

Subtopic 1

Subtopic 4

Subtopic 2

Subtopic 3

Subtopic 5

name: The Charting method
description: The charting method of note-taking is one the most effective for fact- and data-heavy content. It involves creating a diagram or chart to represent the relationships between different concepts or ideas. When the content is highly structured and uniform, the charting method provides an efficient way to keep up with the material.

name: The Sentence method
description: The sentence method of note-taking is the simplest and least structured strategy. It involves writing each idea as a complete sentence. When the content itself is not outlined, then the sentence method can help give your notes a slight structure that the topic is missing.

name: Q/E/C Method
description: With this method, you process your information directly. It's a method you can use when you have more time to take notes. Essentially, you turn the main topic into a question. Then you answer with several facts below and write a concluding sentence or two.
